pr_title: JEP 384: Record final fields not modifiable through reflection

timeline.bodyText:
Would it be better to check for record first? I think there may be a possibility of setting the exception twice here.
ifdef
if (record) {
   your new code
} else
endif
...old code...
timeline.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText: Also, why is the extra check required at all? All modern VMs disallow setting of final fields from outside of constructors.
replies.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText: I retested and it looks like the jcl addition alone is sufficient.
replies.author: theresa-m

timeline.message:
JEP 384: Record final fields not modifiable through reflection

Related to: #9929
Fix: #9529

- implement restrictions on record final fields through reflection
- test that final fields in records cant be modified through reflection
- test that jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe methods objectFieldOffset/staticFieldOffset/staticFieldBase support records
- test that there is no record support for VarHandle.set
Signed-off-by: Theresa Mammarella <Theresa.T.Mammarella@ibm.com>
